title: JamesDaniel90
author: JamesDaniel90
content: Hi all, I started investing in crypto February this year but due to the high price of Bitcoin did not start investing in it until mid June just after the crash. Since then I have been DCA every week and currently own 2% of a Bitcoin at an average price of £17,900. My goal is to hold Bitcoin until it reaches £500k - £1m, i know it will take a long time but will be worth it. I am hoping these current prices last a lot longer so that we can all continue to DCA at low prices. Just wondering how everyone else invests in Bitcoin? How often do you buy and how long do you plan to hold?

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Same as you, buying bitcoin in weekly status or at least when I have fiat at hand and just be a HODL. And since we are in a bear market, they are in a discounted price so we should take advantage of it.And it's also a long term goal for me, I have stocks that I have hold for more than 10 years now so I believed that I can do that to bitcoin or even longer, (at least 3 bull run cycles), so let's see.

comments.author: n0ne
comments.body: What you've done is good. Ongoing market movements were good for DCA, and it is time to make use of it to the maximum. For now I don't have any specific timeline for the holding. I keep holding and sell when I find the price to be high or when a new ATH is being reached. For now from experts view the bear market is supposed to stay long with volatility level supporting trade moves. So, this is a right time to make an entry.

Never lose patience Bitcoin will surely fulfill your dream.If we invest in bitcoins we cannot keep it for a long time. If the price increases a little and from there some amount of profit is actually sold But we don't have that energy to keep for long time because we can't invest for long time due to family.A little profit has to be sold and spent on family work.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Quote from: JamesDaniel90 on September 07, 2022, 11:28:07 PMJust wondering how everyone else invests in Bitcoin? How often do you buy and how long do you plan to hold?As a usual approach, I just accumulate, if possible, regardless of what's the price. Depends also on the budget.There's no specific period for how long should I plan to hold. It really depends on how I looked at a certain trend. But one thing is for sure, I can't afford to hold it for years or plan on holding it within that long timeframe due to the fact that, there are several factors and considerations why should I sell at some point. Sometimes even though I like to hold, there will always be a time that I can't follow it.

comments.author: TravelMug
comments.body: It's obvious that someone's plan is to save as much bitcoin as we can throughout this bear market. If someone has sold everything during the last spike, then good, this is another period to accumulate. And if you didn't sold then continue to amass because the price is cheap. As to what is my preferred price to sell my stash, hard to answer, we all know how scarce bitcoin is, so sooner or later the demand is going to grow. Very difficult unless there is a very important reason to sell your BTC.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: That’s a good way of providing yourself good/low entry points, after all no one really knows where the price is heading at any given time.  Dollar cost averaging is a popular investing strategy and has been for a very long time and for a reason. By the way I personally would not share with other how much you have with anything whether that’s how much bitcoin, or investments in this stock or that, I’d keep it private. Just my 2 on that.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Pretty simple — continue staking slowly but surely, and spend it as much as possible when needed (unless it's the case that I hold too much fiat).Quote from: JamesDaniel90 on September 07, 2022, 11:28:07 PMHow often do you buy and how long do you plan to hold?

I am hoping these current prices last a lot longer so that we can all continue to DCA at low prices. Just wondering how everyone else invests in Bitcoin? How often do you buy and how long do you plan to hold?I also do DCA but in the next cycle or when the market overheats and we see that we break the highs, it is not bad to trim a little of what you have invested and take advantage to spend some bitcoin, because waiting for half a million or a million can take a long time. Having 2% of a bitcoin is not much for now but as you accumulate more and it becomes a large percentage of your net worth it is worth thinking about what I am telling you. The fact that bitcoin is in circulation also gives it value. As popular as HODL is, if no one transacted with bitcoin, it would be worthless.

comments.author: Fara Chan
comments.body: Quote from: JamesDaniel90 on September 07, 2022, 11:28:07 PMMy goal is to hold Bitcoin until it reaches £500k - £1m, i know it will take a long time but will be worth it. In investment terms, we have to put something in the coin that is worth holding on to, so that at any given moment we can see a suitable return, you are doing something right in bitcoin, it just takes time, because right now may not be the right time to let go.Quote from: JamesDaniel90 on September 07, 2022, 11:28:07 PMJust wondering how everyone else invests in Bitcoin? How often do you buy and how long do you plan to hold?Many people do different strategies in carrying out investments, but almost generally people make purchases when prices are low, sometimes people make long-term investments to increase their profit portfolio, but it's also not wrong to use short-term to make small profits, the most important thing is how prepared we are in carrying out investments, both using long-term and short-term

A lot wiser than who started DCA'ing when the price was $60k+.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: price will stay low for a long time because it won't shoot to the moon before halving. two years more so you are lucky that you can afford to DCA weekly. many users in the forum earns BTC thru campaigns. that's just what i would do as well.  but i would rather be trading though than keeping it on a cold wallet.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: JamesDaniel90 on September 07, 2022, 11:28:07 PMJust wondering how everyone else invests in Bitcoin? How often do you buy and how long do you plan to hold?I try to be pretty stable with it but I mostly do it every 2 weeks at least or 1 month at max depending on the current state of my funds. I plan to hold for a long time, especially with the current state we have right now, I see no plans to actually sell and I suck at trading so big no for that one. Been DCA'ing since when Bitcoin started dipping from the last ATH, afaik I'm down by quite a bit but I don't really mind. I don't (and want) to look at it since might get weak hands if I do.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: I bought my first bitcoins when the price was just over $300.... but I was tempted to sell some of it when the price went over $1000. This is a very common mistake that early investors are making, because they have not experienced a 800%+ increase in the price of Bitcoin...so a 200% profit in their investment...seems to be too tempting. I have learnt from my mistakes.... so I buy low.... use some coins (20%) and I hoard (80%) for many years... until Bitcoin reach it's next all-time-high price. I then sell some coins to make a profit and I keep some for the next all-time-high. (also buying more when the price drop)

comments.author: BTC2daIzzo
comments.body: I get a portion of my salary in BTC, I try not touch it if possible. Sometimes I'll exchange for ETH or another top altcoin, but mostly just HODL. I'm essentially DCA automatically with my salary.
